title: DOHA MIT 398-0-71 Undergraduate Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course introduces students to important styles, artistic movements, and film industry developments in the cinemas of the global south. We will discuss the theories behind the different terms that have been used to name these cinemas including "third cinema," "world cinema," "global cinema," and "transnational cinema." The weekly screenings for the class will include several of the most influential feature films of their eras and regions, and their styles will range from popular melodrama to new-wave art films.
